Reviews.Title: “horrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Edayuksel
Reviews.Content: The room was clean but the breakfast was less than "poor." There was just one type of traditional cheese and dead sandwiches. I asked for egg which did not served until I Ielft the breakfastroom after half an hour later from my order. They accepts customers who are not hotel guests and serve them better and quicker than the hotel guests Location is good. It is in the middle of the city and just next to the Mall of Emirates. If you will stay in this hotel please do not take breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms ok - Breakfast horrible”
Reviews.Author: Andreaswil
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveller coming to Dubai a lot and stayed in many hotels here. I have no idea how the others are recommending this hotel over and over. For the price you can get much better deals in Dubai. We paid around 100 USD per room/night. Here are my honest points: - Rooms: The rooms are ok and within the 4 star standard of Dubai. Good are the washing machine, microwave, cooking plates, fridge etc. - for a family who stays longer here and need to cook etc. This is the first hotel room where the TV can NOT be seen from the bed. The TV is in the living room part of the room. - Internet: You have wireless in the room (the internet is very slow, I made a speedtest and had around 180 kbs for download). This is enough for a very low quality skype connection but not more. Sure not appropriate is the 450 AED they are charging me for one week. If you need a wired connection the cable you have to use will reach maximum the couch - not the bed. - Food: The breakfast is really horrible. Please see the pictures for more reference. So you can see the evidence The selection is very very small. Nearly nothing is there. Only one juice (package), one type of bread, small and try sausages, the scrambled eggs were already gray. So sliced cheese, nothing. I have never seen such a small selection in any hotel - whereever I have stayed in the past. Only plus - if you ask they cook a omlette for you. by the way: If you are muslim take care. There was ham served inside sandwiches without any special sign in front of it. General: The hotel is close to the emirates mall, this is a plus of course. When I arrived the code card was not correct programmed so I could not open the door. When I came back to the reception the worker there offered me to send somebody to show me. She was behaving like I am a complete idiot. I am very dissapointed about the price and what you get for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Apt in great location”
Reviews.Author: ingrid c
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights during Ramadan. Hotel catered for all our needs. Positive points are great location, nice clean room which was cleaned daily, friendly staff (esp housekeeping/gym/swimming staff who were all very accommodating & polite) Tea/sugar/coffee refills stocked up daily. Large fridge to keep cold drinks in. Pool area small though suited us as only us there most days. Gym equipment sufficient and treat yourself to a massage. Wow! Negative no coffee pods for coffee machine....use extra & you have to pay for them. Take extra clothes hangers. Taxis outside are in abundance & are all very cheap. Would recommend this establishment more so for its prime location as its just a stroll away from the Emirates Mall. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “An average property in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mrsbaa85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was arranged for business, good value price in a great location, within walking distance to the Mall Of the Emirates. They have different style rooms, mine was basic 2 twin beds pushed together to make a bed with a tiny bathroom with shower. Watch out for the doorstop placed in front of the toliet, banged my foot on that every time. The kitchen was nice granite and appliances but with only 2 plates, couple of pots and several utensils there wasnt much cooking going on. My freezer never worked and since the hotels icemachine was broken, having a cold drink wasnt happening. I did not have a washingmachine as promised but they did very promptly install one. Only used a couple of times, way too noisy and u could only put in a couple pieces of clothing. No laptop either provided in room, didnt really matter, the internet signal was hit or miss. Had to ask daily for washcloths, towels rather hard and scratchy and often ragged. Rooftop pool was very nice, the gym had everything I needed and the attendants were very courteous and always quick with a towel. The breakfast buffet was good, I often asked for fresh eggs or an omelette and these requests were delivered upon quickly by the friendly staff. The hotel was hot in the hallways and also very noisy when familes arrived. They stay up late, making it hard to sleep for those who have an early wakeup call, which was delivered by a human and accurate everyday.

Reviews.Title: “one of the BEST value hotels in dubai”
Reviews.Author: a7_mad1991
Reviews.Content: Golden Tulip is an apartment hotel . The rooms are very spacious and clean . It acts like a 5 star hotel with the value of a 4 star hotel ! The hotel is 3 minutes away from mall of the emirates.. It has a 24 hours cafe , a spa , swimming pool and a gym ! There is a laptop in the room but to use the internet on this laptop is not free , but if you bring your own laptop the internet is for free . The staff are helpful and friendly.. The beds are kinda OK but the pillows were awful. The room kitchen has a microwave , an espresso machine and other things . I really loved it and would DEFINITELY go there again

Reviews.Title: “If you want any thing doing, do it yourself”
Reviews.Author: Gingercatlover
Reviews.Content: Arrived and discovered a mark on the bedroom wall that looked like someone had spat on it. Asked reception that next morning to have it cleaned, also for extra coat hangers. Got back in the evening- nothing done- same the next day although the coat hangers did appear on the second time of asking. In the end asked cleaners ourselves to do it. Breakfast buffet was a mediocre choice of food and chaotic. Everyday we had to ask for something (spoons, plates, bread etc). Cleaning staff were very friendly and helpful as were pool and gym staff. if only all the staff were like that. Rooms were large and in fairly good condition although don't think about self catering unless you are just heating up a ready meal, there is no equipment. Pool very nice but only 1 umbrella. There are always taxis outside the hotel and Mall of the Emirates is next door so a good location and easy to get around and I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT IN EVERY WHICH WAY!”
Reviews.Author: 1valerie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a GEM! The location is just perfect -- about a 3 minute walk to Mall of the Emirates/Ski Dubai, 8 minute walk to Metro, about an 8 minute drive to Burj al Arab/beaches. My husband and I travelled from Los Angeles to Dubai for 3 days only to take in culture, experience. This hotel was 10x better than expected. Our room (#315) was super cozy with a cute kitchen and washer/dryer which we used. The bathroom was super modern w/ a GREAT shower and shower head. The restaurant downstairs (La Mode) offered great breakfast (free to guests), FYI>>BEST COFFEE EVER! KIMBO ESPRESSO TO DIE FOR. Service was exceptional>> Amine & Mosey were kind and efficient at the front dest while bellman Mohammed was the kindest, warmest individual who was willing to help at anytime. Thank you Mohammed! You must stay here! : )

Reviews.Title: “Surprising impressed !”
Reviews.Author: ItalGrecoLon
Reviews.Content: My first stay at a Golden Tulip and in a city like Dubai where 5 star establishments are in abundance, I have to admit, I was pleasantly surprised and will reconsider my options for Dubai in the future. We stayed in a standard studio suite. I have been put off in the past in the U.S. in staying in a bedroom with a kitchen attached. However - and possibly because the hotel is new, it did feel like a studio apartment. The room : Large. Kitchen area, completely tiled. Fridge/freezer, microwave, tea/coffee facilities, espresso maker, toaster ... everything you could need. Breakfast bar with stools. Sitting area : Small couch, flat screen tv with an abundance of channels and a laptop! Sleeping area : Bed not visible upon entry to the room, queen sized bed which was very comofortable. Ample cuboard and wardrobe space. Bathroom : Not huge, but a large walk in shower with fantastic water pressure. Easily accomodate 3 people if you were that way inclined. Location is 5 mins walk from the Mall of the Emirates where there is a large Carrefour supermarket. Not suggesting self catering, unless that is what you're looking for, however, breakfast at the hotel was $18 and for someone like me who is happy with toast and fruit for breakfast, the kitchen facility came in handly as did the supermarket. Directly opposite the hotel is the Novotel Suites and Ibis, around the corner a large Holiday Inn and Kempinski. So in terms of infrastructure, it's an established area. The Mall of the Emirates Metro is just under 1 km walk. Restaurants in the Mall and a few around the hotel. There is free wireless access at the roof top cafe, which also serves as a shisha venue. You can sit there without purchasing anything and avail of the wireless network at any time. There is also wireless access in the coffee shop attached to the hotel, which is open 24 hours. A spa with steam room and gym, which, although I did not use, I believe are free for hotel guests. The only negative thing I could possibly add, although did not affect me too much, the pool on the roof is small as are the number of loungers. It did not affect us because for the best part, we were the only ones using it. Negative in the sense that if you were on a leisure trip, it could affect your enjoyment. But, there are beach clubs you can go to a short taxi ride away and they are very reasonable. All in all, after travelling to Dubai for over 20 years, weighing up the cost of the 5 star hotels and their locations ( Jumeirah ), the use of beach clubs etc I would certainly consider this hotel again. I paid 1/3 of the price I would usually spend on a hotel night and can honestly say, I had more money left in my pocket to spend at some good restaurants with booze. A taxi ride, at night, was approx 60 Dirhams.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Perth_Four
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the Mall of the Emirates and the Dubai Ski Centre. I booked with Expedia and explicitly requested a non smoking room, but was told that none was available. However, when I got to the room, there was no smoke smell and no evidence of smoking. The rooms were very well appointed and clean. The beds were comfortable and clean and the kitchen facilities were more than adequate. The facilities (the pool, etc.) were very good well maintained. Each room had a television and the hotel also provided free use of a laptop. I wouldn't say that the hotel was great value for money, but certainly wasn't overpriced for the facilities provided. I would stay here again and recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value, position and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: VitaBella10
Reviews.Content: This hotel/suites is a great place to stay in Dubai. It is close to the metro and close to the Mall of the Emirates, both easy walking distance. We initially took the metro from the airport to the hotel and this was not difficult. Very cost effective as well. As we arrived later in the evening at the Suites this did not put the staff off. They were helpful and extremely attentive. So much so, the initial room we were given smelt of cigarette smoke despite being a non-smoking hotel, and we asked if it would be possible to have a non-smoking room. This was attended to within minutes with a single telephone call, & followed up by the reception staff with a further call an hour later in the new room, to see if we were comfortable and happy with everything. Breakfast down stairs in the La Mode restaurant was lovely and very enjoyable. So much so we are having breakfast there tomorrow. So to conclude..... if you are looking for somewhere to stay in Dubai do not hesitate to book the Golden Tulip Suites as you will very happy at the cleanliness and furnishing in the rooms. The closeness to popular sites and public transport fantastic. And if you have time book yourself on the "Tour Dubai Big Bus", starting at the Mall of the Emirates just a short walk away. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Suite with everthing that you need”
Reviews.Author: ShaunScotland
Reviews.Content: Had a stop over in Dubai and stayed for 2 nights in this lovely suite. It cost us 480 AED a night. For this we got a lovely one bedroom suite with washing machine and fully equiped kitchen plus a buffet breakfast downstairs in the cafe. The TV had an amazing amount of channels and good lot of them in english which was handy as my partner had an illness and had to stay in. We both had an excellent quiet sleep in a very comfortable bed which was helped by the curtains over lapping each other and blocking out the light of day so that it was dark even when the sun was up. The Tulip is within easy walking distance of the the Emirates Mall and the ski slope. Plus from their if you want you can catch the elevated train line. As we had flight at 2000hrs we asked for a late check out until 1600hrs for this they gave it to us free of charge an excellent gesture. Now I have stayed in many 5 star hotels and the service that the Tulip Suites gave surpassed them all. It was cheaper, better equiped and with better service well worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!! WOWWW”
Reviews.Author: Jog3ee
Reviews.Content: What an AMAZING place to stay!! We simply LOVED it .. stayed for 6 nights and enjoyed every moment of our stay at this place! We opted for the club studio and the setting was lovely, given the deal that we got it was just superb (AED 269/nite wid taxes and no breakfast). We didnt try eating at the hotel as emirates mall is just 5 mins walk and less thn 100 meters thr's a grocery store where u can get most of the stuff u need. A metro station connects to emirates mall which made travelling easier and cheaper! The room had a com4table bed, 32" lcd tv with approx 72 chanels! a FULL kitchen, its not worth being called a kitchenette as it almost had everythign 1 needs in the kitchen along with a washer/dryer. The setting of the room was very trendy and cozy, the bathrooms however were a bit smaller but thats ok! All in all a REALLY nice place to stay and at VERY affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Flimbo
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be a great value for money. The suites are perfectly fitted for business travelers, but we enjoyed it a lot for leisure also. Being the closest nabour to Mall of Emirates gave us the opportunity to do the shopping whenever we wanted as this mall is open to midnight. The breakfast could have been better and we did miss the opportunity to enjoy a class of beer or a drink (this is a dry hotel), but all in all we could not expect more for the deal we were given. A small pool at the roof, not crowdy. A small supermarket just outside the hotel, lot of taxis driving by and centrally located if you want to go to the beach, Madinat, Dubai Marina, Dubai Mall or the Palm. A metro station is situated on Mall of Emirates, 3min walk, that can take you to all the above mentioned sites, old Dubai, Karama and airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: PossD
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Golden Tulip twice now and have found it to be a great choice for Dubai. It's located within a 5 to 10 minute walk of the Emirates’ Mall (mall with the ski slope), within a 4 block radius is several restaurants, a couple pharmacies, two or three dry cleaners, hair salons, and grocery stores. The rooms are very clean and lay out nicely. The kitchens are almost full size with a washers (downside is it the British washer & dryer comb). The only downsize to the hotel is getting to Sheik Zayed road can be a pain. It has a pretty good restaurant for those who don't want to leave and a bar upstairs. O' almost forgot, it cost me about 335 AEDs per night (including breakfast) - a nice price for Dubai. It’s a great choice!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Golden Tulip Suites Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: P.O.Box 282464, Dubai 282464, United Arab Emirates
